title: Your guide to L.A.'s 'mansion tax' proposal to build more housing, Ordinance ULA
dc:creator: Times staff
description: Ordinance ULA would impose a one-time 4% tax on property sales above $5 million that would rise to 5.5% on transactions above $10 million.
content:encoded: Ordinance ULA would impose a one-time 4% tax on property sales above $5 million that would rise to 5.5% on transactions above $10 million.

media:content.media:description: Long Beach, CA - July 13: As a cockroach crawls beneath the bus bench Mario Blanco, 53, sits with all his belongings and his dog "Leo the Lion," Wednesday, July 13, 2022, in Long Beach, CA. They stay on the bus briefly and then they exit the bus. They just left Days Inn and he is not certain where he is heading. He decides to go to the emergency room at the hospital. (Francine Orr / Los Angeles Times)
